overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It emphasizes handling daily seasonality while acknowledging data constraints, ultimately selecting a simple averaging method after evaluating alternatives like SARIMA and exponential smoothing. The approach prioritizes feasibility given the text-based environment and short history.
common_data_patterns: Potential downward trend in recent data
Hourly pattern variations (e.g., higher daytime values)
No missing values in input data
key_insights: Short data history (4 days) limits complex modeling of trends or weekly seasonality
Daily patterns can be captured through hour-of-day averaging
Recent anomalies (e.g., temperature drop on last day) are smoothed rather than extrapolated
Forecast horizon matching historical period length enables pattern repetition
Data precision consistency (6 decimal places) maintained in output
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough method evaluation, but ultimately implements simple heuristics due to data limitations. Includes multi-step justification, pattern analysis, and manual calculations while avoiding computationally intensive models.
